DalitzChiSq Class Reference

Class that generates elimination X^2 contours and minimalist X^2 values, also used as a calculation helper for other classes to retrieve the variances or opening angles of and between particles. Uses the particle structs from the vectorFactory class as the standard for accessing information about the event and particles. More...

Detailed Description

Class that generates elimination X^2 contours and minimalist X^2 values, also used as a calculation helper for other classes to retrieve the variances or opening angles of and between particles. Uses the particle structs from the vectorFactory class as the standard for accessing information about the event and particles.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DalitzChiSq::DalitzChiSq (  ) 

Empty constructor that initializes mass values.

Member Function Documentation

double DalitzChiSq::generateContour ( pObject  ap1,
pObject  ap2,
pObject  p1,
pObject  p2,
pObject  p3,
int  bins,
double  offset 
)

Creates a contour map of the curvature space explored in the Elimination ChiSq function. Uses the actual unsmeared event to center the contour.

Parameters:
ap1 The particle 1 (positron) struct of the unsmeared event
ap2 The particle 2 (electron) struct of the unsmeared event
p1 the particle 1 (positron) struct
p2 the particle 2 (electron) struct
p3 the particle 3 (photon) struct
bins the number of bins for the contour histogram
offset the +/- range to plot in from the x1,x2 actual values, should be on the order of .001

double DalitzChiSq::getEliminationChiSq ( double  x1,
double  x2,
pObject  p1,
pObject  p2,
pObject  p3 
)

evaluates the X^2(x1,x2,x3) function, used to explore the x1, x2 (mean) space and used later approximate the minimum of the X^2 function

Parameters:
x1 the "mean" curvature of the positron
x2 the "mean" curvature of the electron
p1 the particle 1 (positron) struct
p2 the particle 2 (electron) struct
p3 the particle 3 (photon) struct
Returns:
the X^2(x1,x2,x3) value with mean curvatures x1 and x2 which also define x3(x1,x2)

double DalitzChiSq::getMinimalistChiSq ( pObject  p1,
pObject  p2,
pObject  p3 
)

Evaluates the X^2(x1,x2,x3) function such that x1 x2 X^2 terms are exactly 0 and the mean x3 is given by the mass constrained energy.

Parameters:
p1 the particle 1 (positron) struct
p2 the particle 2 (electron) struct
p3 the particle 3 (photon) struct
Returns:
the X^2(x1,x2,x3) value evaluated such that x1 and x2 have 0 contribution and x3(x1,x2)
